website_summaries.verdict: If you're seeking a reliable lock that won't break the bank, this one promises to be the best bang for your buck.
pros: Stands out for its efficient design, which doesn't require cutting any screw holes in the door
cons: Touchpad isn't quite as intuitive as that of the Schlage

website_summaries.verdict: A basic keyless deadbolt lock. It's a great product for a competitive price.
pros: Flashing status light can be checked from a distance

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 45 days/Return window is 30 days.
customer_reviews.text: Received 6/16. Installed 6/17. Broke 7/31. Return window closed 7/16. I’m an Amazon junkie and this is by far the biggest letdown from them so far. Device locks fine -doesn’t unlock...just makes a wimpy whir sound. Yes-I put fresh batteries in it. Thank God I have a garage door opener as I hadn’t hid the key outside yet. Super disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Rene' S. Alonzo

customer_reviews.title: Defective unit? Four AA batteries lasts about 4 weeks!!.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this used but it seems to be defective as it uses up four AA batteries every 4 weeks or so. I ordered it around Nov 2017, installed it around Jan 2018 and have gone through five or six sets of batteries. At first I thought it was the strike plate interfering with the bolt so I tried to adjust the positioning. I went so far as removing the strike plate altogether and it's still using up batteries as quick as I change them.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Che

customer_reviews.title: Received used/defective product
customer_reviews.text: I have never had a problem in the past with purchasing a Like New - open box product before - but this takes the cake. All of the parts bags were open and screws were floating around in box - Not a good sign, but gave it the college try. Installing went along easy enough; however, upon putting it together, the Door/Lock Handling Process failed by not opening up the lock all way - after repeated attempts - still not able to open all of the way.
customer_reviews.author: campingirl

customer_reviews.title: Won't unlock
customer_reviews.text: We have had this lock for just over a year, and it does not work at all anymore. It will not unlock and we have been locked out of the house several times now. It works occasionally, but for the most part we have stopped using it with the code because it doesn't seem to remember the cod 3/4 of the time. We just use it with a regular key. Very disappointing for a basically new lock.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Z.

customer_reviews.title: Defective 10 days after 30 day return window closed
customer_reviews.text: The turning mechanism broke 10 days after just after the 30 day return window closed. It won't open from the outside at all. It tries but bolt stops half way. From inside, it won't even work manually without forcing it. It definitely. The bolt stops half way, even if door wide open with no tension. $80 down the drain. It worked when first installed fine. I tried changing batteries, it's not that.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: First one died, excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the front door of my garage because I always drive different cars for work and feared I would forget my key. I have a similar lock from a different manufacturer so I already knew how convenient it was to just put in my code. This lasted 5 months before the keypad totally stopped responding. I thought it could be the batteries but after verifying it had good batteries I called Kwickset customer service to get some assistance. The person I talked to was very helpful and sent me a new unit. Replacing just the electronic portion saved me from changing keys and took all of 3 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Jason W.

customer_reviews.title: Motor is powerful
customer_reviews.text: I have the exact product that gave up the ghost recently. I liked the overall product and it lasted 6-7 years so OK fine, so I ordered another to simplify replacement. The new one has a better, more torquey motor so I'm very pleased. I'm PO'd at Amazon for playing games with pricing. Depending on which COLOR you order the price varies $20 or so. I guess now that Amazon has knocked out most traditional retail we are about to get a lesson in predatory economics from them. I'm definitely open to finding competitors going forward. (Wonder how long this review survives auto-parsing scrutiny?)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Review after 4 years of use
customer_reviews.text: Mechanically and electronically this lock is still working well. However the finish is deteriorated to the point that I'm considering sending it in for a warranty claim. Yes it comes with a lifetime finish and mechanical warranty, but you have to send it in. The door only receives a few hours of midday sunlight each day. The satin nickel is now appearing to be gold on the outside hardware. The door handle below is also from the same manufacture and its finish is failing even faster.
customer_reviews.author: AngieA

customer_reviews.title: Keyless entry didnt work
customer_reviews.text: After installing and setting up, about 15 minutes later the lock started beeping. Then the keypad was completely dead. Kwikset wants you to contact them, so I did. They verified that the keyboard would not work and said they would send out another one. That was weeks ago and I still haven't received a new lock. I also live overseas and have to pay additional shipping. So because I have had to wait over a month for a replacement unit and I have to pay additional shipping (that Kwikset wouldnt pick up) I give it a 1 star for poor manufacturing.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: KeyPad Stays lit all the time and the batteries have ...
customer_reviews.text: KeyPad Stays lit all the time and the batteries have died twice now in less than a week. Took me a month to get around to installing it so now I can't return. I'm on hold now with Kwikset Customer Service but I really doubt they'll be very helpful. Fingers crossed....
customer_reviews.author: Ted Shred

customer_reviews.title: BIG issue with this lock: BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: You cannot slide off the panel to change the code nor to replace its batteries. All other Kwikset locks have this feature, which allows you to simply slide the panel up and program. I had to Youtube three times to figure it out, and all the videos showed the simple slide up method. It does not work with this lock. Do not show out included smart key coding device (a piece of metal) or you cannot program it to use your own key if its power fails. With this lock, you have to unscrew the entire thing from your door. I needed an eye glass screwdriver to do so. I hate this lock.
customer_reviews.author: My Hummel OpinionTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't lock or unlock UPDATE: Fixed
customer_reviews.text: This thing is garbage. When I initially install the battery pack and press and hold the lock key it will unlock and lock. However, after programming in a code, and using the code, it just errors and fails to actually unlock the deadbolt. UPDATE!!! I was unable to get this lock working with any Alkalines I had laying around but switching to NiMH rechargable batteries totally solved the problem. Now it's awesome! It seems to lock and unlock reliably for about 6 months on a single charge.
customer_reviews.author: Sirdigsbyceasar

customer_reviews.title: Not so smart. Noisy locking mechanism that auto locks too soon, whether door is open or closed.
customer_reviews.text: Works great with limitations. The auto lock engages too soon for us. Wish we could adjust the time. The lock is not very smart. It locks whether the door is closed or not. Needs to have a sensor affirming the door is closed. If you leave the door ajar it will lock in the open position. Pretty simplistic mechanism. Very important to put the lock in the locked position at installation before inserting the battery pack. It seemed to be facing the wrong way for our door but when the battery pack is installed, the “handing” is adjusted automatically.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn M

customer_reviews.title: Has issues
customer_reviews.text: Replaced this with same model that lasted 7 years. Replaced easy but new one failed the same way with in 25 days of install. The power lock function malfinctions and disabled the hand throw making it useless. Only fix was to go out and use the buttons to open. Then it worked fine until you hit the power lock. Replaced it with kwickset model power bolt 2 and that model works great.
customer_reviews.author: ArtWithStyle

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: We are enjoying this tremendously. It feels solid and the auto-close works great. The keypad is convenient. It also looks just like the ones that are wired into an expensive alarm system and cost twice as much. The only issue I have is the auto-lock timeout is not adjustable. The 30 second timeout is just a little too quick for a jog to the car and back for a forgotten item. If I close it, I have to put groceries down because it locked. If I leave the door open, half the time I forget and kick it closed, at which point the extended bolt bangs painfully against the trim.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Eats batteries
customer_reviews.text: In the beginning, this was great. We originally had a version where the keypad had an accompanying thumbturn. This one was nice because we didn't have to go through that minor, but extra step, of turning it to unlock the door. However, we've been using this more electronic version for the last 3 months and are already on our 3rd set of batteries. With the other one, I think one set of batteries lasts at least 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Amelina

customer_reviews.title: Great smartkey deadbolt
customer_reviews.text: We’ve stopped carrying keys since installing these. You can customize the codes, and it allows multiple codes so you can enter a temporary code for the cleaning company, etc. Entering and deleting codes is simple. Installation is simple. The frequently used buttons don’t fade, so someone can’t look and see what code numbers routinely get used. Battery only needs replaced about once a year. This also uses the smartkey technology so you can set all your kwikset smartkey locks to use the same key....all the doors in the house, deadbolt and not, use a single key. If the key gets lost or the house sells, all the locks can be easily re-keyed.
customer_reviews.author: Sttomper

customer_reviews.title: Our second one; worth it.
customer_reviews.text: This is our second unit that we just purchased. The only thing we recommend is using lithium energizer batteries. The Duracell seem to corrode and will give you issues (this is a defect in batteries, not the lock). You can program this to a remote, smart hub (if your "Fancy"), but what's great is you can add two codes, one for your house keepers, in-laws, etc, and then your main code. They hold up well (first is 7 years old), so we recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Whispering Barrels

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We really enjoy the ease of this lock. During the day we use this deadbolt exclusively....a lot easier using the keypad than fiddling with keys, especially after walking the dogs or grocery shopping. We were so happy with this lock we bought one for the garage door too. Granted it's not a smart lock, but we have wink so get notifications when door is opened and closed. I also like the versatility of adding other numbers into the unit when we have someone taking care of our home while on vacation. I should also add that we've had the lock for nearly a year and still haven't had to change out the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: K.J.

customer_reviews.title: Just as described
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the brushed nickel unit from Home Depot two years ago and LOVE it. We just moved and needed a second one in bronze, but Home Depot didn't have it in stock. We can't tell a difference at all in quality, and the bronze color is just as described. As far as the electronic keypad goes in general, we really love the convenience. It's impossible to lock yourself outside, and you can give house guests their own code if needed. I don't have to carry keys when I go for a walk or run, and I don't have to dig in my pockets for keys while carrying groceries in. I'll never go back to a regular deadbolt!
customer_reviews.author: ase

customer_reviews.title: Stuck Closed
customer_reviews.text: This lock worked OK for a few days and then began to not open, which necessitated the use of a key to open it. It seemed like the mechanism was over-extending the bolt when electronically closed and then was not powerful enough to reverse the operation when using the key code. Also, the cover for the inside lock was plastic with a nickel finish, which raised durability concerns. It was removed and returned to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Great Lock
customer_reviews.text: This lock does everything it’s advertised to do. I’m a pretty good handyman and I had no problem installing it. If you follow the directions to a tee you will be fine. The only time I had an issue was when I went off script. I decided to deactivate the auto lock feature because I don’t have young kids here who need to be reminded to lock the door. I will likely buy another one for my front door.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Lee

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for very long. Had this item less than a year and half and it's no longer functioning :(
customer_reviews.text: Loved this key-less entry and would have given it 5 stars, but after less than a year and half it no longer works. We thought it was just a simple switch of batteries needed, but that did not fix the issue. Seems like the motor is probably to blame as it still makes the beeping noises, but the lock will not turn. For the cost (close to $100) I don't feel this product is worth it. I will look into other brands that will hopefully last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Kohler

customer_reviews.title: after first battery change it doesn't last at all
customer_reviews.text: First of all, when this thing actually worked it was nice. Able to program a code, and use it to get in and out just fine. Install was not too bad, however a little tricky just based on some of the angles where you need to screw stuff in. First set of batteries lasted a pretty long time. THEN, when I replaced the batteries, they almost immediately drained... within about a month. I am not about to let this thing eat batteries. Thankfully it can still be used as a deadbolt lock. for the price I paid for it, it is total garbage. Wouldnt buy again
customer_reviews.author: K. Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is great. It has options to turn beep sound on or off. You can set multiple codes. You can also set it to auto lock after 30 seconds if you like. Make sure you measure before you order that the distance between the edge of the door and the center of the lock will fit. I got this and the lock was too long so I had to buy a drill to make the hole longer. Also, for some reason, the manual lock doesn't stop straight up and down. It overshoots to the right more. Just a picky thing for me but not functional. Any questions? Contact me at emailraines@yahoo.com
customer_reviews.author: G. Raines

customer_reviews.title: No fear
customer_reviews.text: I write this having experienced two attempted installations of Tacklife deadbolt system. Both attempts ended in failure in that, after laborious installation and equally laborious programming, the unit ultimately didn’t work. This was my third installation and was night and day. Super easy installation, well worded instructions, really easy programming and all-around awesome. I normally don’t write reviews but this product deserves a good review. As for longevity, I can only hope the effort into design is equal to it’s longevity. Time will tell. I have faith that this will open when it needs to and close.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Just type your code and open sesimi. Spelled right?
customer_reviews.text: Real nice lock. No wifi. Just how I like it. Put in the code. It opens. 30sec later it locks automatically. Holds 8 codes. The smart key is the bomb, match my key to lock in 1 minute. As long as it is a kwikset type key. KW1 type. Many keys are. Install can be a little involved according to your door. READ directions guys. If door opens and locked fine before then this will be plug and play, if not get out the chisel. But finish is nice. Metal outside portion, plastic cover inside. But looks like metal. Heavy plastic though. Settings to beep, blink and auto lock.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Rex

customer_reviews.title: So Happy
customer_reviews.text: I went back and forth on whether or not we were going to go straight to the Smart Home lock and after reading some reviews about software update issues (which makes total sense) I decided to save the money and go with the battery operated keypad lock. I am sooo happy with this. Autolock feature is fantastic for when the kids "forget" to lock the door.
customer_reviews.author: Not So New Mom

customer_reviews.title: Best on the market Simple and Easy!
customer_reviews.text: This lock is excellent! I made sure to read reviews on so many other locks and decided to go with this lock because it had all the features that i needed and it was a standard lock fitting so there would be no hassle slipping it right in. I love it it’s perfect and nomore digging for my keys out of purse. My husband enjoys too. The rekey feature was super easy and took 1 minute to read instruction and custom for my existing key to the new lock!!! Easy instructions too Thank you this is the best amazon purchase ever!
customer_reviews.author: Pretysweet

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, watch the alignments
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves it. Locks with single button after closing the door. Set a 4 number combination and easy to open even with hands full of bags. Has worked about 2 months so far with no problems. I paid attention to aligning the deadbolt in the door to lock without the dragging experienced with most key locks. The deadbolt has a slight taper on front and rear sides helping slide into the door frame if door is not exactly closed tight. Unit did get confused with bolt stuck out once including gouging the door when locking with door not fully closed. Took out the batteries, reinstalled and lock reset with the same combination to open it.
customer_reviews.author: Spudbytes

customer_reviews.title: Life upgrade
customer_reviews.text: This lock has been a great addition to our front door. Installed it myself (maybe 30 minutes after skimming directions). Lock feature works great, occasionally it will not lock correctly but that may be that the door is not shut correctly when this happens and it makes a different noise so I know when this occurs and if I push the door I hear the lock slide into place. Then I just push the lock button again. Has a nice modern look and I like that it has a key Incase I would ever need it as backup. Such a great time saver and peace of mind when you forget your key!
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Holy Doorlocks Batman!
customer_reviews.text: Holy doorlocks, Batman! This thing works great! I have purchased a total of 3. Two I brought 10 uears ago and they worked perfectly. The third I just bought, which leads us to the Holy door locks, Batman! Installation was a challenge. Follow the directions to the T, and you will mess up a step. The programming of the locking cycle, you must push down and hold the LOCK button on the FRONT of the set up. Next, you might need to seemingly hyperextend the proper installation of the manual locking position. Other than that, we love the unit!
customer_reviews.author: Rock

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the front door. It stayed in the box for a little over a year until we could finally decide on a new front door. I installed it almost a year ago and the batteries haven't even died yet so it only is used moderately. Randomly it is malfunctioning and keeps trying to lock itself even when it's already locked. I checked and made sure the auto lock feature is turned off and I changed out the batteries just to make sure. Still no good. I expected more from a higher end lock like this.
customer_reviews.author: JOE LEDET

customer_reviews.title: Reliable but not wifi connected
customer_reviews.text: Initially bought the wifi connected product for my front door. It never did connect to my wifi. I have two others that “sometimes” connect. Anyway this one at front door was left open for 4-5 hours and failed to operate after. I tried reinstalling hardware, wifi info etc about 3 times. Finally I gave up and threw it away out of frustration. I replaced it with this non wifi connected product. It is more robust. I did like the wifi features that I had integrated with samsung SmartThings. When it worked it was good. But it’s reliability for remote control was a coin toss on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: Radar

customer_reviews.title: Solid purchase, adjustable for install
customer_reviews.text: Got this unit to replace a messed up old deadbolt. The unit comes with an internal piece that is adjustable in length so you're not stuck with the size you get. This was super helpful because as shipped it was too large for the door. A quick screw or two later and it fits perfectly in the door-lock housing. Overall works great, fairly easy to install. Wires are a bit cramped so if you can afford to have 2 folks working on it then you should do so. It will make it easier. Last few steps fall in line pretty easy once you get the initial stuff out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor B.

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: This is my first try at an electronic lock. The install was pretty straight forward. Programing was simple. I had to modify the door frame because the deadbolt hole was too shallow and this caused the lock to get "upset". As others have said, it is a little loud while it is operating. I turned off the keypad sounds to make it a little quieter. I have had both installed for a few weeks and am still working on my first set of batteries. I will be purchasing another one for the shed.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Dulaney

customer_reviews.title: Align,align ,align
customer_reviews.text: I really like this lockset. If your door is not predrilled take your time and be accurate. Almost perfect alignment is needed for the backset and strike plate hole. It doesn't have a lot of closing torque but if alignment is spot on it works very well. Easy to program and directions are clear. I've installed three units so far with good results
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Best lock for home security with auto lock.
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is awesome. Unfortunately I bought a like new one to save money and joke was on me as the previous owner included random keys and not the keys for lock so while the keypad works I have to buy a reset mechanism for $30 to rekey the cylinder so I can have a key as back up. The only thing I have a love hate relationship with is when it auto locks it is very loud and startles me after I’ve walked away and forgotten about it. It does this even if you manually lock it before walking away as a precaution.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: So far we love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: We installed the lock and were blown away by how great the instructions were and how easy the installation is. With most projects, something doesn't go just right and the instructions are not well written. Not this time. Kwikset did a great job! We love the way the lock works also. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Bob Kohrs

customer_reviews.title: Backlighting doesn't stay on long enough.
customer_reviews.text: The keys are not backlit... seems like a lot of these reviews reflect this functionality never working or stopped working shortly. Mine never worked. Update, I figured out how to make it backlit but it only stays lit while you push it, and immediately goes off after you pull your finger away, sort of making the lighting a bit cumbersome... leaving my review as 2 starts now instead of 1.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: You may have to wait for a part to be delivered.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, there are two types of installations for the dead bolt assembly, but Kwikset only puts one in the box. If your door happens to need part "b" you have to call the company to have it sent to you. This takes 7-10 days to arrive, thus you have to put your old deadbolt back on. There is no warning of this inconvenience in the description. Most doorknob sets/locks come with both options, but not this one. Not sure if I would buy this product again, even though I want matching locks on both doors.
customer_reviews.author: Birdlady

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: This lock has an auto-lock feature. This is what we needed. Also, we needed a push-button lock so we could enter with hands mostly filled up and not have to dig for keys. It has a feature that also tries to relock the bolt if it is initially obstructed because the door didn't align just right. This has done the job well. It is easy to install, especially if you have installed a home deadbolt before. It seems to have a long battery lift. It also looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality Control Issues
customer_reviews.text: Once I installed the lock and tried to plug in the cable, part of the connector was improperly molded at the factory causing the pins to break and rendering the lock completely useless. Called Kwikset and they acknowledged that it sounded like a factory defect. Opted to return the lock. Obvious quality control problems at their manufacturing facility. Also compared the weight to a Schlage lock I've used in another location and was surprised how light it was.
customer_reviews.author: progro

customer_reviews.title: Only worked for 1.5 years
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about it, except it didn't work for long. When I arrived to let my son's dog out, I was unable to get in. Very frustrating. When he called KwikSet, he got no help. The batteries were changed several times, it just didn't work any longer.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: This is a GREAT product and was easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT product and was easy to install. I installed this on my front door earlier this summer and it has worked flawlessly ever since. It's so nice to come home and not have to fumble and stumble for my keys and just be able to punch a couple buttons and the door will open. I love it! I have to say that I also installed some motion detector lamps on the walls around the front door which makes it even easier to see what I'm doing. The only thing missing, and this is why I'm only giving it four stars, is because the keypad does not light up.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Wirth

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but LOUD!
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install and worked fine, but good grief ... motor is loud enough to wake the neighbors; definitely not for use at a condo. I even called the tech help line ‘cause just “knew” it had to be malfunctioning. They assured me it was normal, so it was uninstalled and returned.
customer_reviews.author: Travelin' Librarian

customer_reviews.title: Easy to rekey!
customer_reviews.text: Took a little longer to install then the comparable product from Schlage (15 minutes VS about 5) but it works great once it's set up! I chose this over the Schlage because this one I could re-key my self. It took MAYBE 30 seconds to re-key the lock once it was installed. That part could not have been easier. I would buy this again. Even thought it took a little longer to install, that's just a one time thing. This seems like it will hold up for years and years. Very solid metal construction.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Pea

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Way to Lock
customer_reviews.text: My brother in law installed it for me...... and I love it..... I no longer leave my front door unlocked so my family can come in and out without the lock / unlock ritual...... keyless entry and easy to use....Wished I would have had it sooner..... but grateful to have it now.
customer_reviews.author: sharon

customer_reviews.title: GREAT LOCK
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these locks and they work great! Since that time a neighbor ordered 3 of them that I easily installed for them. With one lock there was a small issue and I can tell you Kwikset customer service and follow up was the best. I truly believe they are a company that stands behind their product and want Customer Satisfaction. VERY HAPPY I would have probably went to the more expensive one for the illuminating buttons if I had to do over but again very happy.
customer_reviews.author: PAW

customer_reviews.title: Buy another model, wish I could return it.
customer_reviews.text: My friend has a lock like this and she is able to change the codes WITHOUT opening the back. Opening the back defeats the purpose and usefulness of the product. Buy another MODEL that you don't have to open the back up every time you want to change the code.
customer_reviews.author: LaurelOlivia

customer_reviews.title: Locked us out of our house
customer_reviews.text: TRUE REVIEW!!! We purchased this product in May 2020, within 2 months of use, this product started malfunctioning. It locked us out of our house with our 1 year old infant inside. We had to call 911 and break through our doors. Repairs were beyond the security this product could provide.
customer_reviews.author: Tallahassee Guy

customer_reviews.title: Backlight?  Find in the dark?  Not really
customer_reviews.text: The manufacturer proudly announces that the 6-digit keypad is backlit so that you can find it easily in the dark. Well not exactly. There may be 6 buttons, but one is dedicated as the LOCK button. I'd call this a 5-digit keypad. As for BACK-LIT...not exactly. The keypad is totally dark until you can find and hit the lock button. So I still need a flashlight handy to find the lock button in order for turn on the backlighting.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Cohn

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love these. I bought 2 and they work perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these. I bought 2 and they work perfectly. I've had them for several months and so far the batteries are still working. We had a locksmith install them for us and he even said how they are great locks and very secure. It is so nice to know you can't get locked out of your house and it helps to get in and out even if your hands are full - so easy to just push in a number. They also look great!
customer_reviews.author: Katie W.

customer_reviews.title: You need to be a DIYer
customer_reviews.text: Install 7 of these in two homes in existing locks setups. Some were easy peasy and a few required some adjustments involving knowing how to use woodworking tools, screw drivers, drills. Got all to work to my complete satisfaction, just do not expect the lock to levitate from the box to the door. Each lock was separately keyed with a tool that would allow me to convert all locks to the same key.
customer_reviews.author: Passion4Diving

customer_reviews.title: We've had two and trouble with both
customer_reviews.text: We had one for about two years then it started sticking so we could not lock it from the inside very easily. Thinking it was just because that one was a couple of years old, we replaced it with a new one. Not even 6 months later, the same problem came back. My husband took it out, checked it, lubricated and a short time later, the inside lock/unlock feature didn't work right again. Next time a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley H

customer_reviews.title: Quality control issues?
customer_reviews.text: I bought and installed this electronic deadbolt when I sought my house. It worked for 9 years with no issues, then just stopped working. I bought a replacement and after installing, it didn’t work. Kwikset Customer Service verified the defect and sent me another but that took almost 2 weeks! I had to remember to bring a house key every time I left. A little miffed that it broke to begin with but equally ticked-off that it took almost 2 extra weeks to get replacements. I now have parts from 3 deadbolts in my entry. Other than that, I love the whole process of electronic locks.
customer_reviews.author: Inquiring Mind

customer_reviews.title: Works well over time
customer_reviews.text: After getting locked out of my house several times, I am glad I finally purchased this deadbolt. It installs easily and is easy to use. I had an issue once when someone got the lock stuck halfway between open and closed, but that was a user error that was easily remedied. I have changed the batteries once since I bought it a year ago, but I usually use the key instead of the motorized lock. I save that for emergencies. I like being able to assign a temporary code for contractors, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Knox

customer_reviews.title: Died after a year. Expensive manual deadbolt.
customer_reviews.text: It was great for the first year. I love not having to worry about getting locked out. BUT 3 months after the 1 year warranty it died. The company wont help at all because after 1 year they wont do anything to help. Dont waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew James Self

customer_reviews.title: New Home, new locks
customer_reviews.text: We recently purchased a new home and new locks. I have a bad habit of locking my keys inside so this is a fantastic choice for us. We had some trouble with installation, even after watching videos. The Kwikset customer service line was incredibly helpful and had us installed in no time. We have had this lock on our home for months and the batter still seems to be going strong, the keypad and hardware is still in great shape. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: HumanIcicle

customer_reviews.title: Great house warming gift!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this type of combination lock for many years and love it! so when our daughter and then our son purchased their homes we gave them the same thing. Now this one is for my brother's new home. They all love them as much as we do. The lock lets you pick at least two different combinations so he used ours for one and our son's (his godson) for the second one. It the perfect gift for a new homeowner.
customer_reviews.author: Pat M

customer_reviews.title: Best thing ever!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't here when my husband installed it - first he said, "There are a LOT of parts!" But in the end he said it was quite simple. However he was initially surprised - it didn't seem straight forward and he is one of those do-it-all fix-it-all build-it-all type of guys. Really happy with it so far - it has been in for about two months; we don't use it every day (detached garage). Ordered another for the front door :)
customer_reviews.author: Pet momma

customer_reviews.title: Buy this Kwikset over the Schlage...
customer_reviews.text: Two years ago I purchased a Kwikset electronic lock for my garage and 'splurged' a bit with a Schlage 'Touch' one for the front door. The Kwikset on the garage door has performed flawlessly throughout the seasons. The Schlage Touch catastrophically failed and after going through 2 of them I bought this Kwikset. So, far it has worked without fail and should last too. The prior ones were purchased through a Mass Merchandiser home center....I did not think to look on Amazon. Should have done so - based on the reviews the Kwikset is far superior.
customer_reviews.author: Madman X Water

customer_reviews.title: Good quality deadbolt at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this deadbolt. It is easy to install and having a code to unlock is really nice compared to remembering to carry a key every time you go out a side or backdoor and want to come in the fromt . The mechanism action is very smooth. The outside keypad looks good and isn't as bulky as some other manufacturer's deadbolts. I wish the inside piece could be smaller but haven't seen any other deadbolts that aren't just as bulky. I kinda like the red and green light that flashes to indicate whether the lock is engaged or not. It is nice at night to be able to tell without going up to the door.
customer_reviews.author: Spence Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Batteries run out too fast
customer_reviews.text: In theory I like this lock, but the batteries died within a month of installation. I thought maybe I had not put fresh batteries in. But nope, I opened a new package and the batteries died within a couple of weeks. It defeats the purpose for my kids to have to all carry keys - the whole point was they never remembered to take their keys with them, or they left them laying around at school. Now I have to deal with them getting locked out of the house at least once a month.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah P

customer_reviews.title: Very good lock setup
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product and quality. The installation isn't complicated as long as you know what you're doing but nevertheless the instructions are pretty clear. I installed two of these over 2 years ago and now a third one on a new door and it works flawlessly. The batteries last very long, I use rechargeable ones and have recharged my two older locks once since the intial install. Try it out, I doubt you'll be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: John k

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably priced and easy to install. We had one for a year or two and installed one for my son's family because the teenagers kept losing their house keys. I would add, we had one before that, a different model, which cause difficulty. After it was out of warranty Kwikset replaced it with a new better model free. I recommend them and will use their products again. Their SmartKey allows one key to open all Kwikset locks. Great idea.
customer_reviews.author: JHD

customer_reviews.title: Nice products usually but mine did not work
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning this and buying a very similar one in store. This one just didn't work. I kept taking it apart and trying again with no success. No clue whether this version is just touchy or I bought a junk one. I made sure to buy a different one ultimately from Home Depot but it was the same brand! These things are so nice to have overall, just a bad experience with this one personally.
customer_reviews.author: Lilly

customer_reviews.title: Too loud
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this Kiwkset 909 thinking the autolock option would be a great feature. The lock works well and does autolock after a few seconds. Its pretty easy to install and set up. We didn't like the fact that the lock cannot be maintained open if needed. Once it is set for autolock it will automatically lock all the time. Also the lock is very loud when it shuts down making us jump if we are too close. We sent it back to replace with Schlage BE365VPLY505 which we like a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: JC Chestnut

customer_reviews.title: No more key to come in my front door
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this keyless entry lock. Just press the lock button when I leave and enter my code when I come home. I bought the whole entry handle and keyless lock set and it's positively beautiful. I had my locksmith install it all, but I think if a person is at all "handy" you could do it yourself, that is if you already have the proper holes drilled in the door frame and on the door.
customer_reviews.author: KLOQWEST

customer_reviews.title: Love this lock
customer_reviews.text: I have had this lock for almost 2.5 years. I just had to replace the original set of batteries for it. The lock is amazing. We use it multiple times daily. It is a blessing with the kids (and forgetful husbands) and not having to deal with having and losing keys. I would highly recommend this lock to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Kristan

customer_reviews.title: Simple - Fast Install
customer_reviews.text: Installation was super fast. TIP --- If you are having trouble with the lock automatically locking all the way and it keeps beeping (happened to me) it's because your hole isn't deep enough for the lock to go all the way in. I took a 1/2" drill bit and deepened the hole and then the locked work great! Don't expect this to be installed without a little modifications to your door...let's be reasonable people.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Easier to punch in numbers. Even my locksmith liked it.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second kwikset code.lock. This one is so much easier for putting in the.code. Thwmothers arentoo small for big fingers. It has worked in my garage.door ow for 4 years. I just moved & bought this for my new house back door. I did have it professionally installed because I had the locksmith out to change all locks in the new house anyway. He really liked it. Made a point of saying it was the first one he put in but liked it alot. Very happy with this product!!!!
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Fasy

customer_reviews.title: Super simple keyless entry with NO Wifi or Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these at each of our homes. They are easy to install - just replaced the previous deadbolt, easy to program, and they are NOT connected wirelessly to the home or a smart phone. I'm sure most people see this as a negative but given how horribly insecure most IOT devices are, I did not want a lock that could easily be hacked. This is as close to a standard keyed deadbolt as you can get but with the convenience of a keypad. You have to change the batteries every six months or so but otherwise, it's been flawless. It's also bump-proof, which is important.
customer_reviews.author: Masen

customer_reviews.title: This deadbolt looks really nice and was very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This deadbolt looks really nice and was very easy to install, even using the SmartKey function to make my existing house key work. It is now so easy to have people come pet sit for me- no more worrying about hiding keys or giving/picking up house keys from people. I bought this during Black Friday 2016 and so far I have only had to change the batteries once- it didn't give me the red flashing light indicating the batteries were dead, some of the keys didn't seem to be working as well, so I just put in fresh batteries and it was working fine again. For a basic electronic lock, this was a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: the perfect door lock for kids and grandmas!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second unit I've purchased; installing it at grandma's house for the grandkids. they love it and grandma loves it too! installation was smooth, although you have to choose the appropriate parts based on your particular door and locks. I swapped out the key cylinder and grandma uses her old key instead of using the new keys that come in the box. a great product!
customer_reviews.author: BranMaxDaddy

customer_reviews.title: A home must
customer_reviews.text: I love these locks. I no longer have to fish in my purse for a key to open the door. The ability to add lock codes allow guests to come and go without having to make them a key. The idea of not having to change locks any more just keys is a real money saver. If your hands are full you can always use your knuckle to punch in the code. These locks have been proven to be burglar proof. All my doors now have these locks.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Alphson

customer_reviews.title: Super Simple Install.  Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what you need if you want to go keyless inexpensively. Install was super easy. I already had a Kwikset deadbolt. I left the entire original deadbolt and strike plate in place. I just slid the new cylinder into place and attached the digital keypad. That was it! Re-Keying the new cylinder was simple, however, I could have just slid the old Kwikset cylinder in and not used the new one at all. That would have been even easier. doesn't matter. It's a piece of cake. That's coming from a mechanically inept individual. You can do this. No problem!
customer_reviews.author: James Williams

customer_reviews.title: Impressive, modern, convenient
customer_reviews.text: Gifted this to my mother for the holidays. It was simple to install and I actually thought we might be able to smart-key it to her current key, but couldn’t. No biggie, it’s sleek in appearance with a brushed finish silver. The lock itself doesn’t make too much noise when engaging or disengaging, however, it’s something you would hear if not expecting the door to unlock. (Great for those with teens trying to sneak in past curfew?). The buttons aren’t gummy and depress nicely. A tone sounds upon each selection, confirming it. I would recommend this and may actually purchase another for her other door.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Bentley

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, easy to program. Took about 15 minutes start-to-finish to replace the old deadbolt on our front door. As long as you don’t want to open your door with your smartphone, this deadbolt lock has all the features you could want. And the override manual key lock has Smartkey, so you can match any other Kwikset - or compatible - locks already in use at your house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more fidgeting with keys in the dark
customer_reviews.text: No more fidgeting with keys in the dark. This takes a little while to install, it took me about 45 minutes. But once installed it works perfect. Four AA batteries control the action. Easy to change codes. Codes change from the inside. Buttons light up at night when you press the lock button, before entering code. Inside it locks like a regular deadbolt. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Lyles

customer_reviews.title: AVOID.
customer_reviews.text: Electronic keypad stopped working after 1.5 years. And there is only a 1 year warranty on electronics. I called customer service and they confirmed this. Their solution is to use a regular key because the mechanical portion still works. But honestly that's not the point. SMH.
customer_reviews.author: gary a miyasaki

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to install. Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to get one of the super smart locks for my home, given the requirement for an additional hub, zigbee, smartphone, etc, etc. I just wanted something that could autolock and support multiple codes. This was perfect for my requirements. Having the option to keep my old keys was a huge plus as well. This unit was super easy to install. It actually took me way longer to remove my old deadbolt than it did to install this. I will be buying another to replace my other deadbolts.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lock for the price
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to install and works great. I wished that I done this years ago. I always would get out to my vehicle then realize that I forgot something so then you would have to shut the car back off pull the keys out to unlock the door. Bummer right! Now just leave my car running with the a/c going in this hot Texas weather, go back to the house punch in my code get what I forgot shut the door push the lock button and off in a nice cool car!
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Davis

customer_reviews.title: Good, Sturdy, and Easy
customer_reviews.text: Just installed this today. So far I’m really impressed! This was my first time installing a smart lock. The installation was super easy with step by step instructions. Also easy to program. The motor for the locking mechanism is loud. I’m sure we will get used to that. Also hope I don’t have to change batteries often. Other than that I’m excited for the updated lock.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Unlocked and locked light
customer_reviews.text: 4.5 stars! I installed this on an exterior door to the garage very easily. My door may have been warped a little fit was snugg. I didn’t use the plate that came with it and it still works. Follow the instructions exactly. The locked indicator light should be a more darker color, I could see someone mistaking unlocked for locked.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great lock, great price
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a smart lock for a while that I could adjust with the keys I had. Also one I was able to put into the door of the place I'm renting without having to pay for extra holes due to 10000 screws. This lock is a great buy. I highly recommend it. I've had no issues with it and it was an easy install, using the already present holes available in the door.
customer_reviews.author: M G

customer_reviews.title: Won’t work with a bolt that requires chiseled opening.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to love it however our bolt required the removal of the face plate on the actual deadbolt - the several other keypad deadbolts we tried allowed for a simple removal of this piece with a flathead screwdriver. This version literally tells you to call Kwikset to request one - I tried calling and after sitting on hold for an hour, I tried the line a second time to leave my number for a call back. After four days, I gave up and am returning. Try Schlage.
customer_reviews.author: J Decks

customer_reviews.title: Works great - easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Locks like this are super handy. No fussing with keys. Everyone in the fam can just know the code. And sometimes if you're working outside in the yard (without your keys, obviously) and try to go in a door - if it's locked you just put the code in. I installed the lock myself and I don't know how to do this kinda' stuff, but it was still really easy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lock
customer_reviews.text: I bought because my mother has a caregiver and I wanted the caregiver to have access to the house if mom was sleeping. The combination works nicely. The inside lock doesn’t work as nice. Mom has difficult locking it. Install for me was fairly easy. The directions aren’t the greatest. There is wire which is very short. Thread it through the hole the wrong way and it for some reason it won’t work. I am thinking the wire was so short it was pulling it from the connection.
customer_reviews.author: April Sheely

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: After locking myself out of the house at 4am taking my dog to relieve himself I decided to listen to my best friend and grab one of these for my door. Installation took around 1 hour including time to remove the old deadbolt and actually follow instructions. So nice not to have to pull out a key when coming and going. Glad it can also be re-keyed at any time like my other locks!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Nettles

customer_reviews.title: Unusable - Item came damaged and unable to return
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item shortly after moving into a new home. Took a few weeks to get to a point where I could install. When I opened the package, I found the item to be damaged. The internal pins are bent. I can lock/unlock the door with a key but the keyless portion - which is the WHOLE POINT OF THIS PRODUCT - is unusable. Shame on me I guess for opening the package outside the Amazon return window as now it appears I have zero recourse to replace. Spent $73 on a pile of junk and I am NOT happy.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Super good smart code lock
customer_reviews.text: Very very very nice smart code lock; Only one issue, I mean not really an issue, but a tips for the other buyers; When you trying to buy this to replace your existing lock, make sure that there are extra handles on your door, this is only a lock set, no handle included, it will be extremely hard to open a door with only this lock set on the door, trust me, I was there : D I will recommend this as the paired handle: Kwikset Juno Half-Dummy Knob in Venetian Bronze
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: great lock
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Kwikset 909 for my front door, and a Kwikset 907 for the garage door. They are both pretty much the same price on Amazon. But the 909 (this lock) is better. It's easy to install (especially if you're replacing another Kwikset lock), and super convenient to use. I love just pushing the button to lock the door. The 909 has more metal parts inside whereas the 907 has some plastic parts, and the 909 has more features. If considering one of these, definitely get the 909.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Greer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a bit
customer_reviews.text: I had this lock for just over a year and it was working great. I loved the auto lock feature and the multiple passcodes, but then one day i replaced the batteries and it just completely crapped out on me. I called kwikset to help me troubleshoot it and in the end they made me go out to buy a different brand of batteries i didnt need, and then after i called them back they proceeded to tell me "sorry i guess there's nothing that you can do its just broke and i dont know why". I got about a year out of it. I hope this doesnt happen to you.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob1115

customer_reviews.title: Fast accurate keys and bolt movement.
customer_reviews.text: I had another Kwikset electronic deadbolt but it was slow to lock / unlock and the keys had to be pressed slowly or one would be missed. This one you can hit the keys as fast as possible and they work instantly. The deadbolt is fast and it doesn't light up unless you hit the lock/unlock key before pressing the buttons to save battery. The motor is louder than my last one but the extra power gives it speed. Easy to program. Would certainly buy again.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Complete thanks to the person on YouTube that uploaded a install video. Only one I could find. He just had the programming procedure wrong, but all else was very helpful. This lock is great! My kids can enter without needing a key that could get lost or stolen. Not sure about longevity as it’s newly installed, but I will update if anything changes. Don’t buy the cheap lower handleset on Amazon. I regretted it. Buy a brand name one.
customer_reviews.author: Asv

customer_reviews.title: Super easy and professional
customer_reviews.text: We installed this at my office and it was super easy to install (replacing an older key lock system). It took less than 30 minutes to install (taking out the older lockset took the most time). Programming the system was easy. Love the individualized combos that we can use too. Seriously considering it for the home now!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good lock, but the interior pieces are plastic.
customer_reviews.text: I had to knock off one star because the parts that mount on the interior side of the door aren't actually brass, they are plastic with a brass-like finish. Other than that, this is a great lock. I installed the previous version (the Kwikset 907) in 2003 and it worked flawlessly for 13 years. It finally stopped working a few days ago, so I bought the predecessor to replace it. I think I'll probably get another 13 or more years out of this lock.
customer_reviews.author: MLTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Smart Lock
customer_reviews.text: I had already bought one for the basement door. The product is fairly simple to set up. Changing the batteries is simply remove a couple of screws. I bought this to replace a broken deadbolt. It works great and can get into your home if you forget your keys. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri

customer_reviews.title: Great Lock for the Price.
customer_reviews.text: This was very simple to install and works like a charm. Very easy to set and reset the two different combinations, as well as the auto locking feature. The price was very reasonable for a lock of this type. I decided on this less expensive model over the Blue Tooth types after reading so many reviews describing how the blue tooth feature only occasionally works on the ones that have it. I'm really pleased with this lock, as is my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald

product_meta.title: Kwikset 909 SmartCode Electronic Deadbolt featuring SmartKey in Satin Nickel
product_meta.description:
Color Name:Satin Nickel| Style:DeadboltFROM THE MANUFACTURER
Step up to designer styles and superior security with Kwikset Signature Series products. SmartCode touchpad electronic deadbolt is the only one-touch locking motorized deadbolt. With your personalized code, you can enter your home with the convenience of keyless entry and the back-lit keypad provides increased visibility. SmartCode is easy to install, program and use and operates on 4 AA batteries. It also features SmartKey re-key technology as the back-up keyway. The crisp, clean appearance of the Satin Nickel finish adds to the overall look of the product and brings a modern feel.
feature_bullets: One touch locking with a motorized deadbolt & back lit keypad for increased visibility
Eight customizable access codes plus a master code option; Compatible with Kwikset (KW1) keyway
Latch has adjustable backset 2 to 3/8 to 2 to 3/4 inches to fit all standard door preparations; Featuring SmartKey Security re key technology
Note: Kindly refer to the user manual provided as a PDF manual in the product description section
Please see installation manual and user manual under technical specification section for additional information

specifications.Warranty Description: Lifetime mechanical and finish warranty. 1 year electronics warranty.
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,760 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
